Peer

public Peer(InetAddress address,
            int port)
Create a Peer from an InetAddress and a port. The IP address is primary; that is to say, it will remain the same regardless of DNS changes. Don't do this if you are dealing with domain names whose IP may change.

Peer

public Peer(String physical,
            boolean allowUnknown)
     throws PeerParseException,
            UnknownHostException
Create a Peer from a string. This may be an IP address or a domain name. If it is the latter, the name is primary rather than the IP address; getHandshakeAddress() will do a new lookup on the name, and change the IP address if the domain name has changed.

Parameters:
physical - The string to be parsed, in the format [ ip or domain name ]:[ port number].
allowUnknown - If true, allow construction of the Peer even if the domain name lookup fails.
Throws:
PeerParseException - If the string is not valid e.g. if it doesn't contain a port.
UnknownHostException - If allowUnknown is not set, and a domain name which does not exist was passed in.

Peer

public Peer(String physical,
            boolean allowUnknown,
            boolean checkHostnameOrIPSyntax)
     throws HostnameSyntaxException,
            PeerParseException,
            UnknownHostException
Create a Peer from a string. This may be an IP address or a domain name. If it is the latter, the name is primary rather than the IP address; getHandshakeAddress() will do a new lookup on the name, and change the IP address if the domain name has changed.

Parameters:
physical - The string to be parsed, in the format [ ip or domain name ]:[ port number].
allowUnknown - If true, allow construction of the Peer even if the domain name lookup fails.
checkHostnameOrIPSyntax - If true, validate the syntax of the given DNS hostname or IPv4 IP address
Throws:
HostSyntaxException - If the string is not formatted as a proper DNS hostname or IPv4 IP address
PeerParseException - If the string is not valid e.g. if it doesn't contain a port.
UnknownHostException - If allowUnknown is not set, and a domain name which does not exist was passed in.
HostnameSyntaxException

Peer

            int port)

getAddress

public InetAddress getAddress()
Get the IP address. Look it up if necessary, but return the last value if it has ever been looked up before; will not trigger a new lookup if it has been looked up before.

getAddress

public InetAddress getAddress(boolean doDNSRequest)
Get the IP address. Look it up if allowed to, but return the last value if it has ever been looked up before; will not trigger a new lookup if it has been looked up before.

getAddress

public InetAddress getAddress(boolean doDNSRequest,
                              boolean allowLocal)
                       throws Peer.LocalAddressException
Throws:
Peer.LocalAddressException

getHandshakeAddress

public InetAddress getHandshakeAddress()
Get the IP address, looking up the hostname if the hostname is primary, even if it has been looked up before. Typically called on a reconnect attempt, when the dyndns address may have changed.
